Articles.Content:
Made a plane that could still fly after i strapped a ton on to the front. Which gave an idea, turned out pretty well. Check it out in this video, sorry about the low quality still trying to figure out good recording methods.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LORvzw7QsRk

Demonstrates hangers ability to refuel and reload 4 times as well as the fighters ability to VTOL or glide in and use parachutes.

Craft Files:

Mobile Hanger - http://www./download/1k49w6fxu73367b/Mobile+Hanger.craft

Fighter - http://www./download/v38143zgsss9f53/Raptor+VAB.craft

Edited December 22, 2013 by DrMiller357

You should set your missiles to fire in linked pairs. It'd look way cooler, and they'd be more accurate.

I'm a fan of fighters myself, mostly space fighters or SSTO variants. You should have a look at some of my threads. Should be easy enough if you just look up all posts made by me.

Edited December 22, 2013 by speedboiae86

Yea I paired them up at the begining but when it comes down to it, I'm still a bad pilot and cant aim for crap lol. So i got with more shots and more chances to hit. It surprisingly handles the offset well.

I bet i could get the raptor into orbit if i get lucky, but i can always strap an extra tank on the front or and/or air intake, hmm gota go try this.

Checked some of your threads that KA-F VTOL SSTO Hornet Mk. II looks awesome, I haven't really go ten into the SSTO or planes really just started to fiddle around with them with the new engine. Gota love ksp always got something new to try.
